pli-tv-pvr11:0.2.eng: The four legal issues and their resolution

pli-tv-pvr11:1.1.eng: There are four kinds of legal issues:

pli-tv-pvr11:1.2.eng: legal issues arising from disputes, legal issues arising from accusations, legal issues arising from offenses, legal issues arising from business.

pli-tv-pvr11:2.1.eng: How many kinds of reopening are there of these four legal issues?

pli-tv-pvr11:2.3.pli: Vivādādhikaraṇassa dve ukkoṭā, anuvādādhikaraṇassa cattāro ukkoṭā, āpattādhikaraṇassa tayo ukkoṭā, kiccādhikaraṇassa eko ukkoṭo—
pli-tv-pvr11:2.3.eng: There are two kinds of reopening of legal issues arising from disputes, four of legal issues arising from accusations, three of legal issues arising from offenses, and one of legal issues arising from business.

pli-tv-pvr11:2.4.pli: imesaṃ catunnaṃ adhikaraṇānaṃ ime dasa ukkoṭā.

pli-tv-pvr11:3.1.eng: When reopening a legal issue arising from a dispute, how many of the principles for settling it does one reopen?

pli-tv-pvr11:3.2.eng: When reopening a legal issue arising from an accusation, how many of the principles for settling it does one reopen?

pli-tv-pvr11:3.3.eng: When reopening a legal issue arising from an offense, how many of the principles for settling it does one reopen?

pli-tv-pvr11:3.4.eng: When reopening a legal issue arising from business, how many of the principles for settling it does one reopen?

pli-tv-pvr11:4.1.eng: When reopening a legal issue arising from a dispute, one reopens two principles for settling it.

pli-tv-pvr11:4.2.eng: When reopening a legal issue arising from an accusation, one reopens four principles for settling it.

pli-tv-pvr11:4.3.eng: When reopening a legal issue arising from an offense, one reopens three principles for settling it.

pli-tv-pvr11:4.4.eng: When reopening a legal issue arising from business, one reopens one principle for settling it.

pli-tv-pvr11:5.1.eng: How many kinds of reopening are there?

pli-tv-pvr11:5.2.eng: In how many ways does a reopening come about?

pli-tv-pvr11:5.3.eng: How many attributes do people who reopen legal issues have?

pli-tv-pvr11:5.4.pli: Kati puggalā adhikaraṇaṃ ukkoṭentā āpattiṃ āpajjanti?
pli-tv-pvr11:5.4.eng: How many kinds of people commit an offense when they reopen a legal issue?

pli-tv-pvr11:6.1.eng: There are twelve kinds of reopening.

pli-tv-pvr11:6.2.eng: A reopening comes about in ten ways.

pli-tv-pvr11:6.3.eng: People who reopen legal issues have four attributes.

pli-tv-pvr11:6.4.pli: Cattāro puggalā adhikaraṇaṃ ukkoṭentā āpattiṃ āpajjanti?
pli-tv-pvr11:6.4.eng: There are four kinds of people who commit an offense when they reopen legal issues.

pli-tv-pvr11:7.1.eng: What are the twelve kinds of reopening?

pli-tv-pvr11:7.2.pli: Akataṃ kammaṃ, dukkaṭaṃ kammaṃ, puna kātabbaṃ kammaṃ, anihataṃ, dunnihataṃ, puna nihanitabbaṃ, avinicchitaṃ, duvinicchitaṃ, puna vinicchitabbaṃ, avūpasantaṃ, duvūpasantaṃ, puna vūpasametabbanti—
pli-tv-pvr11:7.2.eng: “The legal procedure hasn’t been done”; “it’s been done badly”; “it should be done again”; “it’s not been settled”; “it’s been badly settled”; “it should be settled again”; “it’s not been decided”; “it’s been badly decided”; “it should be decided again”; “it’s not been disposed of”; “it’s been badly disposed of”; “it should be disposed of again”.

pli-tv-pvr11:8.1.eng: What are the ten ways that a reopening comes about?

pli-tv-pvr11:8.2.pli: Tattha jātakaṃ adhikaraṇaṃ ukkoṭeti, tattha jātakaṃ vūpasantaṃ adhikaraṇaṃ ukkoṭeti, antarāmagge adhikaraṇaṃ ukkoṭeti, antarāmagge vūpasantaṃ adhikaraṇaṃ ukkoṭeti, tattha gataṃ adhikaraṇaṃ ukkoṭeti, tattha gataṃ vūpasantaṃ adhikaraṇaṃ ukkoṭeti, sativinayaṃ ukkoṭeti, amūḷhavinayaṃ ukkoṭeti, tassapāpiyasikaṃ ukkoṭeti, tiṇavatthārakaṃ ukkoṭeti—
pli-tv-pvr11:8.2.eng: One reopens a legal issue where it arose; one reopens a legal issue where it arose and was resolved; one reopens a legal issue while traveling; one reopens a legal issue that was resolved while traveling; one reopens a legal issue after going there; one reopens a legal issue that was resolved after going there; one reopens a resolution through recollection; one reopens a resolution because of past insanity; one reopens a decision on giving a further penalty; one reopens a decision on covering over as if with grass.

pli-tv-pvr11:9.1.pli: Katamehi catūhaṅgehi samannāgato puggalo adhikaraṇaṃ ukkoṭeti?
pli-tv-pvr11:9.1.eng: What are the four attributes of people who reopen legal issues?

pli-tv-pvr11:9.2.pli: Chandāgatiṃ gacchanto adhikaraṇaṃ ukkoṭeti, dosāgatiṃ gacchanto adhikaraṇaṃ ukkoṭeti, mohāgatiṃ gacchanto adhikaraṇaṃ ukkoṭeti, bhayāgatiṃ gacchanto adhikaraṇaṃ ukkoṭeti—
pli-tv-pvr11:9.2.eng: They reopen legal issues biased by desire, ill will, confusion, or fear.

pli-tv-pvr11:9.3.pli: imehi catūhaṅgehi samannāgato puggalo adhikaraṇaṃ ukkoṭeti.

pli-tv-pvr11:10.1.pli: Katame cattāro puggalā adhikaraṇaṃ ukkoṭentā āpattiṃ āpajjanti?
pli-tv-pvr11:10.1.eng: Who are the four kinds of people who commit an offense when they reopen a legal issue?

pli-tv-pvr11:10.2.pli: Tadahupasampanno ukkoṭeti ukkoṭanakaṃ pācittiyaṃ, āgantuko ukkoṭeti ukkoṭanakaṃ pācittiyaṃ, kārako ukkoṭeti ukkoṭanakaṃ pācittiyaṃ, chandadāyako ukkoṭeti ukkoṭanakaṃ pācittiyaṃ—
pli-tv-pvr11:10.2.eng: If one who was ordained on that very day does the reopening, they commit an offense entailing confession; if one who has newly arrived does the reopening, they commit an offense entailing confession; if the original doer does the reopening, they commit an offense entailing confession; if one who had given their consent does the reopening, they commit an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-pvr11:10.2.comm: Sp 5.341: Kārakoti ekaṁ saṅghena saddhiṁ adhikaraṇaṁ vinicchinitvā pariveṇagataṁ parājitā bhikkhū vadanti “kissa, bhante, tumhehi evaṁ vinicchitaṁ adhikaraṇaṁ, nanu evaṁ vinicchinitabba”nti. So “kasmā paṭhamaṁyeva evaṁ na vaditthā”ti taṁ adhikaraṇaṁ ukkoṭeti. Evaṁ yo kārako ukkoṭeti, “The original doer: having decided a legal issue together with the Sangha, he goes to the yard where the defeated monks say, ‘Venerable, why did you decide the legal issue in that way? Should it not be decided in this way?’ Saying, ‘Why did you not say this straightaway?’ he reopens that legal issue. In this way, the original doer reopens it.”

pli-tv-pvr11:10.3.pli: ime cattāro puggalā adhikaraṇaṃ ukkoṭentā āpattiṃ āpajjanti.

pli-tv-pvr11:11.0.eng: 2. The sources of the legal issues, etc.

pli-tv-pvr11:11.1.pli: Vivādādhikaraṇaṃ kiṃnidānaṃ, kiṃsamudayaṃ, kiṃjātikaṃ, kiṃpabhavaṃ, kiṃsambhāraṃ, kiṃsamuṭṭhānaṃ?
pli-tv-pvr11:11.1.eng: What is the source, the origin, the birth, the arising, the production, the origination of legal issues arising from disputes?

pli-tv-pvr11:11.2.pli: Anuvādādhikaraṇaṃ kiṃnidānaṃ, kiṃsamudayaṃ, kiṃjātikaṃ, kiṃpabhavaṃ, kiṃsambhāraṃ, kiṃsamuṭṭhānaṃ?
pli-tv-pvr11:11.2.eng: What is the source, the origin, the birth, the arising, the production, the origination of legal issues arising from accusations?

pli-tv-pvr11:11.3.pli: Āpattādhikaraṇaṃ kiṃnidānaṃ, kiṃsamudayaṃ, kiṃjātikaṃ, kiṃpabhavaṃ, kiṃsambhāraṃ, kiṃsamuṭṭhānaṃ?
pli-tv-pvr11:11.3.eng: What is the source, the origin, the birth, the arising, the production, the origination of legal issues arising from offenses?

pli-tv-pvr11:11.4.pli: Kiccādhikaraṇaṃ kiṃnidānaṃ, kiṃsamudayaṃ, kiṃjātikaṃ, kiṃpabhavaṃ, kiṃsambhāraṃ, kiṃsamuṭṭhānaṃ?
pli-tv-pvr11:11.4.eng: What is the source, the origin, the birth, the arising, the production, the origination of legal issues arising from business?

pli-tv-pvr11:12.1.pli: Vivādādhikaraṇaṃ vivādanidānaṃ vivādasamudayaṃ vivādajātikaṃ vivādapabhavaṃ vivādasambhāraṃ vivādasamuṭṭhānaṃ.
pli-tv-pvr11:12.1.eng: Legal issues arising from disputes have disputes as their source, their origin, their birth, their arising, their production, their origination.

pli-tv-pvr11:12.2.pli: Anuvādādhikaraṇaṃ anuvādanidānaṃ anuvādasamudayaṃ anuvādajātikaṃ anuvādapabhavaṃ anuvādasambhāraṃ anuvādasamuṭṭhānaṃ.
pli-tv-pvr11:12.2.eng: Legal issues arising from accusations have accusations as their source, their origin, their birth, their arising, their production, their origination.

pli-tv-pvr11:12.3.pli: Āpattādhikaraṇaṃ āpattinidānaṃ āpattisamudayaṃ āpattijātikaṃ āpattipabhavaṃ āpattisambhāraṃ āpattisamuṭṭhānaṃ.
pli-tv-pvr11:12.3.eng: Legal issues arising from offenses have offenses as their source, their origin, their birth, their arising, their production, their origination.

pli-tv-pvr11:12.4.pli: Kiccādhikaraṇaṃ kiccayanidānaṃ kiccayasamudayaṃ kiccayajātikaṃ kiccayapabhavaṃ kiccayasambhāraṃ kiccayasamuṭṭhānaṃ.
pli-tv-pvr11:12.4.eng: Legal issues arising from business have business as their source, their origin, their birth, their arising, their production, their origination.

pli-tv-pvr11:13.1.pli: Vivādādhikaraṇaṃ kiṃnidānaṃ, kiṃsamudayaṃ, kiṃjātikaṃ, kiṃpabhavaṃ, kiṃsambhāraṃ, kiṃsamuṭṭhānaṃ?
pli-tv-pvr11:13.1.eng: What is the source, the origin, the birth, the arising, the production, the origination of legal issues arising from disputes?

pli-tv-pvr11:13.2.eng: … of legal issues arising from accusations?

pli-tv-pvr11:13.3.eng: … of legal issues arising from offenses?

pli-tv-pvr11:13.4.pli: kiccādhikaraṇaṃ kiṃnidānaṃ, kiṃsamudayaṃ, kiṃjātikaṃ, kiṃpabhavaṃ, kiṃsambhāraṃ, kiṃsamuṭṭhānaṃ?
pli-tv-pvr11:13.4.eng: … of legal issues arising from business?

pli-tv-pvr11:14.1.pli: Vivādādhikaraṇaṃ hetunidānaṃ, hetusamudayaṃ, hetujātikaṃ, hetupabhavaṃ, hetusambhāraṃ, hetusamuṭṭhānaṃ.
pli-tv-pvr11:14.1.eng: Legal issues arising from disputes have causes as their source, their origin, their birth, their arising, their production, their origination.
pli-tv-pvr11:14.1.comm: Sp 5.342: Dutiyapucchāya hetunidānantiādimhi vissajjane navannaṁ kusalākusalābyākatahetūnaṁ vasena hetunidānāditā veditabbā, “In the second question, in ‘causes as their source, etc.’: in the reply, causes as their source, etc., is to be understood on account of the nine wholesome, unwholesome, and indeterminate causes.”

pli-tv-pvr11:14.4.pli: kiccādhikaraṇaṃ hetunidānaṃ, hetusamudayaṃ, hetujātikaṃ, hetupabhavaṃ, hetusambhāraṃ, hetusamuṭṭhānaṃ.
pli-tv-pvr11:14.4.eng: Legal issues arising from business have causes as their source, their origin, their birth, their arising, their production, their origination.

pli-tv-pvr11:15.1.pli: Vivādādhikaraṇaṃ kiṃnidānaṃ, kiṃsamudayaṃ, kiṃjātikaṃ, kiṃpabhavaṃ, kiṃsambhāraṃ, kiṃsamuṭṭhānaṃ?
pli-tv-pvr11:15.1.eng: What is the source, the origin, the birth, the arising, the production, the origination of legal issues arising from disputes?

pli-tv-pvr11:15.2.eng: … of legal issues arising from accusations?

pli-tv-pvr11:15.3.eng: … of legal issues arising from offenses?

pli-tv-pvr11:15.4.pli: kiccādhikaraṇaṃ kiṃnidānaṃ, kiṃsamudayaṃ, kiṃjātikaṃ, kiṃpabhavaṃ, kiṃsambhāraṃ, kiṃsamuṭṭhānaṃ?
pli-tv-pvr11:15.4.eng: … of legal issues arising from business?

pli-tv-pvr11:16.1.pli: Vivādādhikaraṇaṃ paccayanidānaṃ, paccayasamudayaṃ, paccayajātikaṃ, paccayapabhavaṃ, paccayasambhāraṃ, paccayasamuṭṭhānaṃ.
pli-tv-pvr11:16.1.eng: Legal issues arising from disputes have conditions as their source, their origin, their birth, their arising, their production, their origination.

pli-tv-pvr11:16.4.pli: kiccādhikaraṇaṃ paccayanidānaṃ, paccayasamudayaṃ, paccayajātikaṃ, paccayapabhavaṃ, paccayasambhāraṃ, paccayasamuṭṭhānaṃ.
pli-tv-pvr11:16.4.eng: Legal issues arising from business have conditions as their source, their origin, their birth, their arising, their production, their origination.

pli-tv-pvr11:17.0.eng: 3. The roots of legal issues, etc.

pli-tv-pvr11:17.1.pli: Catunnaṃ adhikaraṇānaṃ kati mūlāni, kati samuṭṭhānā?
pli-tv-pvr11:17.1.eng: How many roots do the four kinds of legal issues have, and how many originations?

pli-tv-pvr11:17.2.pli: Catunnaṃ adhikaraṇānaṃ tettiṃsa mūlāni, tettiṃsa samuṭṭhānā.
pli-tv-pvr11:17.2.eng: They have thirty-three roots, and thirty-three originations.

pli-tv-pvr11:18.2.pli: Vivādādhikaraṇassa dvādasa mūlāni, anuvādādhikaraṇassa cuddasa mūlāni, āpattādhikaraṇassa cha mūlāni, kiccādhikaraṇassa ekaṃ mūlaṃ, saṅgho—
pli-tv-pvr11:18.2.eng: Legal issues arising from disputes have twelve roots; legal issues arising from accusations have fourteen roots; legal issues arising from offenses have six roots; legal issues arising from business have one root, the Sangha.

pli-tv-pvr11:19.2.pli: Vivādādhikaraṇassa aṭṭhārasabhedakaravatthūni samuṭṭhānā, anuvādādhikaraṇassa catasso vipattiyo samuṭṭhānā, āpattādhikaraṇassa sattāpattikkhandhā samuṭṭhānā, kiccādhikaraṇassa cattāri kammāni samuṭṭhānā—
pli-tv-pvr11:19.2.eng: Legal issues arising from disputes originate from the eighteen grounds for schism; legal issues arising from accusations originate from the four kinds of failure; legal issues arising from offenses originate from the seven classes of offenses; legal issues arising from business originate from the four kinds of legal procedures.

pli-tv-pvr11:20.1.eng: “Is a legal issue arising from a dispute an offense or not an offense?”

pli-tv-pvr11:20.3.eng: “Is it possible to commit an offense because of a legal issue arising from a dispute?”

pli-tv-pvr11:20.5.eng: How many offenses does one commit because of legal issues arising from disputes?

pli-tv-pvr11:20.7.eng: there is an offense entailing confession for abusing one who is fully ordained;

pli-tv-pvr11:20.8.eng: there is an offense of wrong conduct for abusing one who is not fully ordained.

pli-tv-pvr11:21.1.pli: Tā āpattiyo catunnaṃ vipattīnaṃ kati vipattiyo bhajanti?
pli-tv-pvr11:21.1.eng: When it comes to these offenses, to how many of the four kinds of failure do they belong?

pli-tv-pvr11:21.2.eng: To which of the four kinds of legal issues do they belong?

pli-tv-pvr11:21.3.eng: In how many of the seven classes of offenses are they found?

pli-tv-pvr11:21.4.eng: Through how many of the six kinds of originations of offenses do they originate?

pli-tv-pvr11:21.5.pli: Katihi adhikaraṇehi, katisu ṭhānesu, katihi samathehi sammanti?
pli-tv-pvr11:21.5.eng: Through how many kinds of legal issues, in how many places, and through how many of the principles for settling legal issues are they settled?

pli-tv-pvr11:22.1.pli: Tā āpattiyo catunnaṃ vipattīnaṃ ekaṃ vipattiṃ bhajanti—
pli-tv-pvr11:22.1.eng: They belong to one kind of failure:

pli-tv-pvr11:22.3.eng: They belong to legal issues arising from an offense.

pli-tv-pvr11:22.4.eng: They are found in two classes of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr11:22.5.eng: they may be in the class of offenses entailing confession; they may be in the class of offenses of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-pvr11:22.7.eng: They are settled through one kind of legal issue:

pli-tv-pvr11:22.8.eng: a legal issue arising from business.

pli-tv-pvr11:22.9.eng: They are settled in three places:

pli-tv-pvr11:22.10.eng: in the midst of the Sangha, in the midst of a group, or in the presence of an individual.

pli-tv-pvr11:22.11.eng: They are settled through three principles:

pli-tv-pvr11:22.12.pli: siyā sammukhāvinayena ca paṭiññātakaraṇena ca, siyā sammukhāvinayena ca tiṇavatthārakena ca.
pli-tv-pvr11:22.12.eng: they may be settled by resolution face-to-face and by acting according to what has been admitted; or they may be settled by resolution face-to-face and by covering over as if with grass.

pli-tv-pvr11:23.1.eng: “Is a legal issue arising from an accusation an offense or not an offense?”

pli-tv-pvr11:23.3.eng: “Is it possible to commit an offense because of a legal issue arising from an accusation?”

pli-tv-pvr11:23.5.eng: How many offenses does one commit because of legal issues arising from accusations?

pli-tv-pvr11:23.7.pli: Bhikkhuṃ amūlakena pārājikena dhammena anuddhaṃseti, āpatti saṅghādisesassa;
pli-tv-pvr11:23.7.eng: there is an offense entailing suspension for groundlessly charging a monk with an offense entailing expulsion;

pli-tv-pvr11:23.8.eng: there is an offense entailing confession for groundlessly charging someone with an offense entailing suspension;

pli-tv-pvr11:23.9.eng: there is an offense of wrong conduct for groundlessly charging someone with failure in conduct.

pli-tv-pvr11:24.1.pli: Tā āpattiyo catunnaṃ vipattīnaṃ kati vipattiyo bhajanti?
pli-tv-pvr11:24.1.eng: When it comes to these offenses, to how many of the four kinds of failure do they belong?

pli-tv-pvr11:24.2.eng: To which of the four kinds of legal issues do they belong?

pli-tv-pvr11:24.3.eng: In how many of the seven classes of offenses are they found?

pli-tv-pvr11:24.4.eng: Through how many of the six kinds of originations of offenses do they originate?

pli-tv-pvr11:24.5.pli: Katihi adhikaraṇehi, katisu ṭhānesu, katihi samathehi sammanti?
pli-tv-pvr11:24.5.eng: Through how many kinds of legal issues, in how many places, and through how many of the principles for settling legal issues are they settled?

pli-tv-pvr11:25.1.pli: Tā āpattiyo catunnaṃ vipattīnaṃ dve vipattiyo bhajanti—
pli-tv-pvr11:25.1.eng: They belong to two kinds of failure:

pli-tv-pvr11:25.2.eng: they may be failure in morality; they may be failure in conduct.

pli-tv-pvr11:25.3.eng: They belong to legal issues arising from an offense.

pli-tv-pvr11:25.4.eng: They are found in three classes of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr11:25.5.pli: siyā saṅghādisesāpattikkhandhena, siyā pācittiyāpattikkhandhena, siyā dukkaṭāpattikkhandhena.
pli-tv-pvr11:25.5.eng: they may be in the class of offenses entailing suspension; they may be in the class of offenses entailing confession; they may be in the class of offenses of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-pvr11:25.7.pli: Yā tā āpattiyo garukā tā āpattiyo ekena adhikaraṇena—
pli-tv-pvr11:25.7.eng: The heavy offenses are settled through one kind of legal issue:

pli-tv-pvr11:25.8.eng: a legal issue arising from business.

pli-tv-pvr11:25.9.eng: They are settled in one place:

pli-tv-pvr11:25.10.eng: in the midst of the Sangha.

pli-tv-pvr11:25.11.eng: They are settled through two principles:

pli-tv-pvr11:25.12.eng: by resolution face-to-face and by acting according to what has been admitted.

pli-tv-pvr11:25.13.pli: Yā tā āpattiyo lahukā tā āpattiyo ekena adhikaraṇena—
pli-tv-pvr11:25.13.eng: The light offenses are settled through one kind of legal issue:

pli-tv-pvr11:25.14.eng: a legal issue arising from business.

pli-tv-pvr11:25.15.eng: They are settled in three places:

pli-tv-pvr11:25.16.eng: in the midst of the Sangha, in the midst of a group, or in the presence of an individual.

pli-tv-pvr11:25.17.eng: They are settled through three principles:

pli-tv-pvr11:25.18.pli: siyā sammukhāvinayena ca paṭiññātakaraṇena ca, siyā sammukhāvinayena ca tiṇavatthārakena ca.
pli-tv-pvr11:25.18.eng: they may be settled by resolution face-to-face and by acting according to what has been admitted; or they may be settled by resolution face-to-face and by covering over as if with grass.

pli-tv-pvr11:26.1.eng: “Is a legal issue arising from an offense an offense or not an offense?”

pli-tv-pvr11:26.3.eng: “Is it possible to commit an offense because of a legal issue arising from an offense?”

pli-tv-pvr11:26.5.eng: How many offenses does one commit because of legal issues arising from offenses?

pli-tv-pvr11:26.7.pli: Bhikkhunī jānaṃ pārājikaṃ dhammaṃ paṭicchādeti, āpatti pārājikassa;
pli-tv-pvr11:26.7.eng: there is an offense entailing expulsion for a nun who knowingly conceals an offense entailing expulsion;

pli-tv-pvr11:26.8.eng: there is a serious offense for concealing it if she is unsure;

pli-tv-pvr11:26.9.eng: there is an offense entailing confession for a monk who conceals an offense entailing suspension;

pli-tv-pvr11:26.10.eng: there is an offense of wrong conduct for concealing a failure in conduct.

pli-tv-pvr11:27.1.pli: Tā āpattiyo catunnaṃ vipattīnaṃ kati vipattiyo bhajanti?
pli-tv-pvr11:27.1.eng: When it comes to these offenses, to how many of the four kinds of failure do they belong?

pli-tv-pvr11:27.2.eng: To which of the four kinds of legal issues do they belong?

pli-tv-pvr11:27.3.eng: In how many of the seven classes of offenses are they found?

pli-tv-pvr11:27.4.eng: Through how many of the six kinds of originations of offenses do they originate?

pli-tv-pvr11:27.5.pli: Katihi adhikaraṇehi, katisu ṭhānesu, katihi samathehi sammanti?
pli-tv-pvr11:27.5.eng: Through how many kinds of legal issues, in how many places, and through how many of the principles for settling legal issues are they settled?

pli-tv-pvr11:28.1.pli: Tā āpattiyo catunnaṃ vipattīnaṃ dve vipattiyo bhajanti—
pli-tv-pvr11:28.1.eng: They belong to two kinds of failure:

pli-tv-pvr11:28.2.eng: they may be failure in morality; they may be failure in conduct.

pli-tv-pvr11:28.3.eng: They belong to legal issues arising from an offense.

pli-tv-pvr11:28.4.eng: They are found in four classes of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr11:28.5.pli: siyā pārājikāpattikkhandhena, siyā thullaccayāpattikkhandhena, siyā pācittiyāpattikkhandhena, siyā dukkaṭāpattikkhandhena.
pli-tv-pvr11:28.5.eng: they may be in the class of offenses entailing expulsion; they may be in the class of serious offenses; they may be in the class of offenses entailing confession; they may be in the class of offenses of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-pvr11:28.7.pli: kāyato ca vācato ca cittato ca samuṭṭhanti.

pli-tv-pvr11:28.8.pli: Yā sā āpatti anavasesā sā āpatti na katamena adhikaraṇena, na katamamhi ṭhāne, na katamena samathena sammati.
pli-tv-pvr11:28.8.eng: The incurable offense is not settled through any kind of legal issue, in any place, or through any of the principles for settling legal issues.
pli-tv-pvr11:28.8.comm: That is, the offense entailing expulsion.

pli-tv-pvr11:28.9.pli: Yā tā āpattiyo lahukā tā āpattiyo ekena adhikaraṇena—
pli-tv-pvr11:28.9.eng: The light offenses are settled through one kind of legal issue:

pli-tv-pvr11:28.10.eng: a legal issue arising from business.

pli-tv-pvr11:28.11.eng: They are settled in three places:

pli-tv-pvr11:28.12.eng: in the midst of the Sangha, in the midst of a group, or in the presence of an individual.

pli-tv-pvr11:28.13.eng: They are settled through three principles:

pli-tv-pvr11:28.14.pli: siyā sammukhāvinayena ca paṭiññātakaraṇena ca, siyā sammukhāvinayena ca tiṇavatthārakena ca.
pli-tv-pvr11:28.14.eng: they may be settled by resolution face-to-face and by acting according to what has been admitted; or they may be settled by resolution face-to-face and by covering over as if with grass.

pli-tv-pvr11:29.1.eng: “Is a legal issue arising from business an offense or not an offense?”

pli-tv-pvr11:29.3.eng: “Is it possible to commit an offense because of a legal issue arising from business?”

pli-tv-pvr11:29.5.eng: How many offenses does one commit because of legal issues arising from business?

pli-tv-pvr11:29.7.pli: Ukkhittānuvattikā bhikkhunī yāvatatiyaṃ samanubhāsanāya na paṭinissajjati, ñattiyā dukkaṭaṃ;
pli-tv-pvr11:29.7.eng: there is an offense of wrong conduct after the motion when a nun takes sides with one who has been ejected and does not stop when pressed up to three times;

pli-tv-pvr11:29.8.eng: there is a serious offense after each of the first two announcements;

pli-tv-pvr11:29.9.eng: there is an offense entailing expulsion when the last announcement is finished;

pli-tv-pvr11:29.10.pli: bhedakānuvattakā bhikkhū yāvatatiyaṃ samanubhāsanāya na paṭinissajjanti, āpatti saṅghādisesassa;
pli-tv-pvr11:29.10.eng: there is an offense entailing suspension when monks who side with a monk who is pursuing schism do not stop when pressed for the third time;

pli-tv-pvr11:29.11.pli: pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā yāvatatiyaṃ samanubhāsanāya na paṭinissajjanti, āpatti pācittiyassa—
pli-tv-pvr11:29.11.eng: there is an offense entailing confession when not giving up a bad view after being pressed for the third time.

pli-tv-pvr11:30.1.pli: Tā āpattiyo catunnaṃ vipattīnaṃ kati vipattiyo bhajanti?
pli-tv-pvr11:30.1.eng: When it comes to these offenses, to how many of the four kinds of failure do they belong?

pli-tv-pvr11:30.2.eng: To which of the four kinds of legal issues do they belong?

pli-tv-pvr11:30.3.eng: In how many of the seven classes of offenses are they found?

pli-tv-pvr11:30.4.eng: Through how many of the six kinds of originations of offenses do they originate?

pli-tv-pvr11:30.5.pli: Katihi adhikaraṇehi, katisu ṭhānesu, katihi samathehi sammanti?
pli-tv-pvr11:30.5.eng: Through how many kinds of legal issues, in how many places, and through how many of the principles for settling legal issues are they settled?

pli-tv-pvr11:31.1.pli: Tā āpattiyo catunnaṃ vipattīnaṃ dve vipattiyo bhajanti—
pli-tv-pvr11:31.1.eng: They belong to two kinds of failure:

pli-tv-pvr11:31.2.eng: they may be failure in morality; they may be failure in conduct.

pli-tv-pvr11:31.3.eng: They belong to legal issues arising from an offense.

pli-tv-pvr11:31.4.eng: They are found in five classes of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr11:31.5.pli: siyā pārājikāpattikkhandhena, siyā saṅghādisesāpattikkhandhena, siyā thullaccayāpattikkhandhena, siyā pācittiyāpattikkhandhena, siyā dukkaṭāpattikkhandhena.
pli-tv-pvr11:31.5.eng: they may be in the class of offenses entailing expulsion; they may be in the class of offenses entailing suspension; they may be in the class of serious offenses; they may be in the class of offenses entailing confession; they may be in the class of offenses of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-pvr11:31.7.pli: kāyato ca vācato ca cittato ca samuṭṭhanti.

pli-tv-pvr11:31.8.pli: Yā sā āpatti anavasesā sā āpatti na katamena adhikaraṇena, na katamamhi ṭhāne, na katamena samathena sammati.
pli-tv-pvr11:31.8.eng: The incurable offense is not settled through any kind of legal issue, in any place, or through any of the principles for settling legal issues.

pli-tv-pvr11:31.9.pli: Yā sā āpatti garukā sā āpatti ekena adhikaraṇena—
pli-tv-pvr11:31.9.eng: The heavy offense is settled through one kind of legal issue:
pli-tv-pvr11:31.9.comm: That is, the offense entailing suspension.

pli-tv-pvr11:31.10.eng: a legal issue arising from business.

pli-tv-pvr11:31.11.eng: It is settled in one place:

pli-tv-pvr11:31.12.eng: in the midst of the Sangha.

pli-tv-pvr11:31.13.eng: It is settled through two principles:

pli-tv-pvr11:31.14.eng: by resolution face-to-face and by acting according to what has been admitted.

pli-tv-pvr11:31.15.pli: Yā tā āpattiyo lahukā tā āpattiyo ekena adhikaraṇena—
pli-tv-pvr11:31.15.eng: The light offenses are settled through one kind of legal issue:

pli-tv-pvr11:31.16.eng: a legal issue arising from business.

pli-tv-pvr11:31.17.eng: They are settled in three places:

pli-tv-pvr11:31.18.eng: in the midst of the Sangha, in the midst of a group, or in the presence of an individual.

pli-tv-pvr11:31.19.eng: They are settled through three principles:

pli-tv-pvr11:31.20.pli: siyā sammukhāvinayena ca paṭiññātakaraṇena ca, siyā sammukhāvinayena ca tiṇavatthārakena ca.
pli-tv-pvr11:31.20.eng: they may be settled by resolution face-to-face and by acting according to what has been admitted; or they may be settled by resolution face-to-face and by covering over as if with grass.

pli-tv-pvr11:32.1.pli: Vivādādhikaraṇaṃ hoti anuvādādhikaraṇaṃ, hoti āpattādhikaraṇaṃ, hoti kiccādhikaraṇaṃ.
pli-tv-pvr11:32.1.eng: Is a legal issue arising from a dispute a legal issue arising from an accusation, a legal issue arising from an offense, or a legal issue arising from business?
pli-tv-pvr11:32.1.comm: At first sight the Pali appears to be a straightforward declarative statement (“a legal issue arising from a dispute is a legal issue arising from an accusation, a legal issue arising from an offense, and a legal issue arising from business”), not a question. Yet this would mean that the next sentence is a direct contradiction to present one. The sub-commentary clears this is up by saying it is meant as a question. Vmv 5.348: Vivādādhikaraṇaṁ hoti anuvādādhikaraṇantiādīsu vivādādhikaraṇameva anuvādādhikaraṇādipi hotīti pucchāya vivādādhikaraṇaṁ vivādādhikaraṇameva hoti, anuvādādayo na hotīti vissajjanaṁ, “About the phrase vivādādhikaraṇaṁ hoti anuvādādhikaraṇan, etc.: to the question whether a legal issue arising from a dispute is also a legal issue arising from an accusation, etc., the reply is that a legal issue arising from a dispute is a legal issue arising from a dispute, not a legal issue arising from an accusation, etc.”

pli-tv-pvr11:32.2.pli: Vivādādhikaraṇaṃ na hoti anuvādādhikaraṇaṃ, na hoti āpattādhikaraṇaṃ, na hoti kiccādhikaraṇaṃ;
pli-tv-pvr11:32.2.eng: A legal issue arising from a dispute is neither a legal issue arising from an accusation, nor a legal issue arising from an offense, nor a legal issue arising from business.

pli-tv-pvr11:32.3.pli: api ca, vivādādhikaraṇapaccayā hoti anuvādādhikaraṇaṃ, hoti āpattādhikaraṇaṃ, hoti kiccādhikaraṇaṃ.
pli-tv-pvr11:32.3.eng: Nevertheless, because of a legal issue arising from a dispute, there are legal issues arising from accusations, legal issues arising from offenses, and legal issues arising from business.

pli-tv-pvr11:32.5.eng: It may be that monks are disputing, saying,

pli-tv-pvr11:32.6.eng: “This is the Teaching”, “This is contrary to the Teaching” …

pli-tv-pvr11:32.7.eng: “This is a grave offense”, or “This is a minor offense.”

pli-tv-pvr11:32.8.pli: Yaṃ tattha bhaṇḍanaṃ kalaho viggaho vivādo nānāvādo aññathāvādo vipaccatāya vohāro medhakaṃ, idaṃ vuccati vivādādhikaraṇaṃ.
pli-tv-pvr11:32.8.eng: In regard to this, whatever there is of quarreling, arguing, conflict, disputing, variety in opinion, difference in opinion, heated speech, or strife—this is called a legal issue arising from a dispute.

pli-tv-pvr11:32.9.eng: When, during a legal issue arising from a dispute, the Sangha disputes, there is a legal issue arising from a dispute.

pli-tv-pvr11:32.10.eng: When one who is disputing makes an accusation, there is a legal issue arising from an accusation.

pli-tv-pvr11:32.11.eng: When one who is accusing commits an offense, there is a legal issue arising from an offense.

pli-tv-pvr11:32.12.pli: Tāya āpattiyā saṅgho kammaṃ karoti kiccādhikaraṇaṃ.
pli-tv-pvr11:32.12.eng: When the Sangha does a legal procedure because of that offense, there is a legal issue arising from business.

pli-tv-pvr11:32.13.pli: Evaṃ vivādādhikaraṇapaccayā hoti anuvādādhikaraṇaṃ, hoti āpattādhikaraṇaṃ, hoti kiccādhikaraṇaṃ.
pli-tv-pvr11:32.13.eng: In this way, because of a legal issue arising from a dispute, there are legal issues arising from accusations, legal issues arising from offenses, and legal issues arising from business.

pli-tv-pvr11:33.1.pli: Anuvādādhikaraṇaṃ hoti āpattādhikaraṇaṃ, hoti kiccādhikaraṇaṃ, hoti vivādādhikaraṇaṃ.
pli-tv-pvr11:33.1.eng: Is a legal issue arising from an accusation a legal issue arising from an offense, a legal issue arising from business, or legal issue arising from a dispute?

pli-tv-pvr11:33.2.pli: Anuvādādhikaraṇaṃ na hoti āpattādhikaraṇaṃ, na hoti kiccādhikaraṇaṃ, na hoti vivādādhikaraṇaṃ;
pli-tv-pvr11:33.2.eng: A legal issue arising from an accusation is neither a legal issue arising from an offense, nor a legal issue arising from business, nor a legal issue arising from a dispute.

pli-tv-pvr11:33.3.pli: api ca anuvādādhikaraṇapaccayā hoti āpattādhikaraṇaṃ, hoti kiccādhikaraṇaṃ, hoti vivādādhikaraṇaṃ.
pli-tv-pvr11:33.3.eng: Nevertheless, because of a legal issue arising from an accusation, there are legal issues arising from offenses, legal issues arising from business, and legal issues arising from disputes.

pli-tv-pvr11:33.5.pli: Idha bhikkhū bhikkhuṃ anuvadanti sīlavipattiyā vā ācāravipattiyā vā diṭṭhivipattiyā vā ājīvavipattiyā vā.
pli-tv-pvr11:33.5.eng: It may be that the monks accuse a monk of failure in morality, failure in conduct, failure in view, or failure in livelihood.

pli-tv-pvr11:33.6.pli: Yo tattha anuvādo anuvadanā anullapanā anubhaṇanā anusampavaṅkatā abbhussahanatā anubalappadānaṃ, idaṃ vuccati anuvādādhikaraṇaṃ.
pli-tv-pvr11:33.6.eng: In regard to this, whatever there is of accusations, accusing, allegations, blame, taking sides because of friendship, taking part in the accusation, or supporting the accusation—this is called a legal issue arising from an accusation.

pli-tv-pvr11:33.7.eng: When, during a legal issue arising from an accusation, the Sangha disputes, there is a legal issue arising from a dispute.

pli-tv-pvr11:33.8.eng: When one who is disputing makes an accusation, there is a legal issue arising from an accusation.

pli-tv-pvr11:33.9.eng: When one who is accusing commits an offense, there is a legal issue arising from an offense.

pli-tv-pvr11:33.10.pli: Tāya āpattiyā saṅgho kammaṃ karoti, kiccādhikaraṇaṃ.
pli-tv-pvr11:33.10.eng: When the Sangha does a legal procedure because of that offense, there is a legal issue arising from business.

pli-tv-pvr11:33.11.pli: Evaṃ anuvādādhikaraṇapaccayā hoti āpattādhikaraṇaṃ, hoti kiccādhikaraṇaṃ, hoti vivādādhikaraṇaṃ.
pli-tv-pvr11:33.11.eng: In this way, because of a legal issue arising from an accusation, there are legal issues arising from offenses, legal issues arising from business, and legal issues arising from disputes.

pli-tv-pvr11:34.1.pli: Āpattādhikaraṇaṃ hoti kiccādhikaraṇaṃ, hoti vivādādhikaraṇaṃ, hoti anuvādādhikaraṇaṃ.
pli-tv-pvr11:34.1.eng: Is a legal issue arising from an offense a legal issue arising from business, a legal issue arising from a dispute, or a legal issue arising from an accusation?

pli-tv-pvr11:34.2.pli: Āpattādhikaraṇaṃ na hoti kiccādhikaraṇaṃ, na hoti vivādādhikaraṇaṃ, na hoti anuvādādhikaraṇaṃ;
pli-tv-pvr11:34.2.eng: A legal issue arising from an offense is neither a legal issue arising from business, nor a legal issue arising from a dispute, nor a legal issue arising from an accusation.

pli-tv-pvr11:34.3.pli: api ca āpattādhikaraṇapaccayā hoti kiccādhikaraṇaṃ, hoti vivādādhikaraṇaṃ, hoti anuvādādhikaraṇaṃ.
pli-tv-pvr11:34.3.eng: Nevertheless, because of a legal issue arising from an offense, there are legal issues arising from business, legal issues arising from disputes, and legal issues arising from accusations.

pli-tv-pvr11:34.5.pli: Pañcapi āpattikkhandhā āpattādhikaraṇaṃ, sattapi āpattikkhandhā āpattādhikaraṇaṃ, idaṃ vuccati āpattādhikaraṇaṃ.
pli-tv-pvr11:34.5.eng: There are legal issues arising from offenses because of the five classes of offenses, and there are legal issues arising from offenses because of the seven classes of offenses—these are called legal issues arising from offenses.

pli-tv-pvr11:34.6.eng: When, during a legal issue arising from an offense, the Sangha disputes, there is a legal issue arising from a dispute.

pli-tv-pvr11:34.7.eng: When one who is disputing makes an accusation, there is a legal issue arising from an accusation.

pli-tv-pvr11:34.8.eng: When one who is accusing commits an offense, there is a legal issue arising from an offense.

pli-tv-pvr11:34.9.pli: Tāya āpattiyā saṅgho kammaṃ karoti kiccādhikaraṇaṃ.
pli-tv-pvr11:34.9.eng: When the Sangha does a legal procedure because of that offense, there is a legal issue arising from business.

pli-tv-pvr11:34.10.pli: Evaṃ āpattādhikaraṇapaccayā hoti kiccādhikaraṇaṃ, hoti vivādādhikaraṇaṃ, hoti anuvādādhikaraṇaṃ.
pli-tv-pvr11:34.10.eng: In this way, because of a legal issue arising from an offense, there are legal issues arising from business, legal issues arising from disputes, and legal issues arising from accusations.

pli-tv-pvr11:35.1.pli: Kiccādhikaraṇaṃ hoti vivādādhikaraṇaṃ, hoti anuvādādhikaraṇaṃ, hoti āpattādhikaraṇaṃ.
pli-tv-pvr11:35.1.eng: Is a legal issue arising from business a legal issue arising from a dispute, a legal issue arising from an accusation, or a legal issue arising from an offense?

pli-tv-pvr11:35.2.pli: Kiccādhikaraṇaṃ na hoti vivādādhikaraṇaṃ, na hoti anuvādādhikaraṇaṃ, na hoti āpattādhikaraṇaṃ;
pli-tv-pvr11:35.2.eng: A legal issue arising from business is neither a legal issue arising from a dispute, nor a legal issue arising from an accusation, nor a legal issue arising from an offense.

pli-tv-pvr11:35.3.pli: api ca kiccādhikaraṇapaccayā hoti vivādādhikaraṇaṃ, hoti anuvādādhikaraṇaṃ, hoti āpattādhikaraṇaṃ.
pli-tv-pvr11:35.3.eng: Nevertheless, because of a legal issue arising from business, there are legal issues arising from disputes, legal issues arising from accusations, and legal issues arising from offenses.

pli-tv-pvr11:35.5.pli: Yā saṅghassa kiccayatā karaṇīyatā apalokanakammaṃ ñattikammaṃ ñattidutiyakammaṃ ñatticatutthakammaṃ, idaṃ vuccati kiccādhikaraṇaṃ.
pli-tv-pvr11:35.5.eng: Whatever is the duty or the business of the Sangha—a legal procedure consisting of getting permission, a legal procedure consisting of one motion, a legal procedure consisting of one motion and one announcement, a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements—this is called a legal issue arising from business.

pli-tv-pvr11:35.6.eng: When, during a legal issue arising from business, the Sangha disputes, there is a legal issue arising from a dispute.

pli-tv-pvr11:35.7.eng: When one who is disputing makes an accusation, there is a legal issue arising from an accusation.

pli-tv-pvr11:35.8.eng: When one who is accusing commits an offense, there is a legal issue arising from an offense.

pli-tv-pvr11:35.9.pli: Tāya āpattiyā saṅgho kammaṃ karoti kiccādhikaraṇaṃ.
pli-tv-pvr11:35.9.eng: When the Sangha does a legal procedure because of that offense, there is a legal issue arising from business.

pli-tv-pvr11:35.10.pli: Evaṃ kiccādhikaraṇapaccayā hoti vivādādhikaraṇaṃ, hoti anuvādādhikaraṇaṃ, hoti āpattādhikaraṇaṃ.
pli-tv-pvr11:35.10.eng: In this way, because of a legal issue arising from business, there are legal issues arising from disputes, legal issues arising from accusations, and legal issues arising from offenses.

pli-tv-pvr11:36.1.eng: When there is resolution through recollection, is there also resolution face-to-face?

pli-tv-pvr11:36.2.eng: When there is resolution face-to-face, is there also resolution through recollection?

pli-tv-pvr11:36.3.eng: When there is resolution because of past insanity, is there also resolution face-to-face?

pli-tv-pvr11:36.4.eng: When there is resolution face-to-face, is there also resolution because of past insanity?

pli-tv-pvr11:36.5.eng: When there is acting according to what has been admitted, is there also resolution face-to-face?

pli-tv-pvr11:36.6.eng: When there is resolution face-to-face, is there also acting according to what has been admitted?

pli-tv-pvr11:36.7.eng: When there is a majority decision, is there also resolution face-to-face?

pli-tv-pvr11:36.8.eng: When there is resolution face-to-face, is there also a majority decision?

pli-tv-pvr11:36.9.eng: When there is a further penalty, is there also resolution face-to-face?

pli-tv-pvr11:36.10.eng: When there is resolution face-to-face, is there also a further penalty?

pli-tv-pvr11:36.11.eng: When there is covering over as if with grass, is there also resolution face-to-face?

pli-tv-pvr11:36.12.eng: When there is resolution face-to-face, is there also covering over as if with grass?

pli-tv-pvr11:37.1.pli: Yasmiṃ samaye sammukhāvinayena ca sativinayena ca adhikaraṇaṃ vūpasammati—
pli-tv-pvr11:37.1.eng: There may be an occasion when a legal issue is resolved by resolution face-to-face and resolution through recollection.

pli-tv-pvr11:37.2.pli: yattha sativinayo tattha sammukhāvinayo, yattha sammukhāvinayo tattha sativinayo, na tattha amūḷhavinayo, na tattha paṭiññātakaraṇaṃ, na tattha yebhuyyasikā, na tattha tassapāpiyasikā, na tattha tiṇavatthārako.
pli-tv-pvr11:37.2.eng: Then, when there is resolution through recollection there is also resolution face-to-face, and when there is resolution face-to-face there is also resolution through recollection; but there is not resolution because of past insanity, nor acting according to what has been admitted, nor a majority decision, nor a further penalty, nor covering over as if with grass.

pli-tv-pvr11:37.3.pli: Yasmiṃ samaye sammukhāvinayena ca amūḷhavinayena ca …pe…
pli-tv-pvr11:37.3.eng: There may be an occasion when a legal issue is resolved by resolution face-to-face and resolution because of past insanity. …

pli-tv-pvr11:37.4.eng: by resolution face-to-face and by acting according to what has been admitted …

pli-tv-pvr11:37.5.eng: by resolution face-to-face and by a majority decision …

pli-tv-pvr11:37.6.eng: by resolution face-to-face and by a further penalty …

pli-tv-pvr11:37.7.pli: sammukhāvinayena ca tiṇavatthārakena ca adhikaraṇaṃ vūpasammati—
pli-tv-pvr11:37.7.eng: There may be an occasion when a legal issue is resolved by resolution face-to-face and by covering over as if with grass.

pli-tv-pvr11:37.8.pli: yattha tiṇavatthārako tattha sammukhāvinayo, yattha sammukhāvinayo tattha tiṇavatthārako, na tattha sativinayo, na tattha amūḷhavinayo, na tattha paṭiññātakaraṇaṃ, na tattha yebhuyyasikā, na tattha tassapāpiyasikā.
pli-tv-pvr11:37.8.eng: Then, when there is covering over as if with grass there is also resolution face-to-face, and when there is resolution face-to-face there is also covering over as if with grass; but there is not resolution through recollection, nor resolution because of past insanity, nor acting according to what has been admitted, nor a majority decision, nor a further penalty.

pli-tv-pvr11:38.1.pli: Sammukhāvinayoti vā sativinayoti vā ime dhammā saṃsaṭṭhā udāhu visaṃsaṭṭhā?
pli-tv-pvr11:38.1.eng: Is a resolution face-to-face and a resolution through recollection connected or disconnected?

pli-tv-pvr11:38.2.pli: Labbhā ca panimesaṃ dhammānaṃ vinibbhujitvā vinibbhujitvā nānākaraṇaṃ paññāpetuṃ?
pli-tv-pvr11:38.2.eng: Is it possible to completely separate them and point to their difference?

pli-tv-pvr11:38.3.eng: Is a resolution face-to-face and resolution because of past insanity …

pli-tv-pvr11:38.4.eng: Is a resolution face-to-face and acting according to what has been admitted …

pli-tv-pvr11:38.5.eng: Is a resolution face-to-face and a majority decision …

pli-tv-pvr11:38.6.eng: Is a resolution face-to-face and a further penalty …

pli-tv-pvr11:38.7.pli: sammukhāvinayoti vā tiṇavatthārakoti vā—ime dhammā saṃsaṭṭhā, udāhu visaṃsaṭṭhā?
pli-tv-pvr11:38.7.eng: Is a resolution face-to-face and covering over as if with grass connected or disconnected?

pli-tv-pvr11:38.8.pli: Labbhā ca panimesaṃ dhammānaṃ vinibbhujitvā vinibbhujitvā nānākaraṇaṃ paññāpetuṃ?
pli-tv-pvr11:38.8.eng: Is it possible to completely separate them and point to their difference?

pli-tv-pvr11:39.1.eng: Resolution face-to-face and resolution through recollection

pli-tv-pvr11:39.3.pli: na ca labbhā imesaṃ dhammānaṃ vinibbhujitvā vinibbhujitvā nānākaraṇaṃ paññāpetuṃ.
pli-tv-pvr11:39.3.eng: and it is not possible to completely separate them and point to their difference.

pli-tv-pvr11:39.4.eng: Resolution face-to-face and resolution because of past insanity …

pli-tv-pvr11:39.5.eng: Resolution face-to-face and acting according to what has been admitted …

pli-tv-pvr11:39.6.eng: Resolution face-to-face and a majority decision …

pli-tv-pvr11:39.7.eng: Resolution face-to-face and a further penalty …

pli-tv-pvr11:39.8.eng: Resolution face-to-face and covering over as if with grass

pli-tv-pvr11:39.10.pli: na ca labbhā imesaṃ dhammānaṃ vinibbhujitvā vinibbhujitvā nānākaraṇaṃ paññāpetuṃ.
pli-tv-pvr11:39.10.eng: and it is not possible to completely separate them and point to their difference.

pli-tv-pvr11:40.0.eng: 9. The sources of the seven principles for settling legal issues

pli-tv-pvr11:40.1.pli: Sammukhāvinayo kiṃnidāno, kiṃsamudayo, kiṃjātiko, kiṃpabhavo, kiṃsambhāro kiṃsamuṭṭhāno?
pli-tv-pvr11:40.1.eng: What is the source, the origin, the birth, the arising, the production, the origination of resolution face-to-face?

pli-tv-pvr11:40.2.pli: Sativinayo kiṃnidāno, kiṃsamudayo, kiṃjātiko, kiṃpabhavo, kiṃsambhāro, kiṃsamuṭṭhāno?
pli-tv-pvr11:40.2.eng: What is the source, the origin, the birth, the arising, the production, the origination of resolution through recollection?

pli-tv-pvr11:40.3.pli: Amūḷhavinayo kiṃnidāno, kiṃsamudayo, kiṃjātiko, kiṃpabhavo, kiṃsambhāro, kiṃsamuṭṭhāno?
pli-tv-pvr11:40.3.eng: What is the source, the origin, the birth, the arising, the production, the origination of resolution because of past insanity?

pli-tv-pvr11:40.4.pli: Paṭiññātakaraṇaṃ kiṃnidānaṃ, kiṃsamudayaṃ, kiṃjātikaṃ, kiṃpabhavaṃ, kiṃsambhāraṃ, kiṃsamuṭṭhānaṃ?
pli-tv-pvr11:40.4.eng: What is the source, the origin, the birth, the arising, the production, the origination of acting according to what has been admitted?

pli-tv-pvr11:40.5.pli: Yebhuyyasikā kiṃnidānā, kiṃsamudayā, kiṃjātikā, kiṃpabhavā, kiṃsambhārā, kiṃsamuṭṭhānā?
pli-tv-pvr11:40.5.eng: What is the source, the origin, the birth, the arising, the production, the origination of a majority decision?

pli-tv-pvr11:40.6.pli: Tassapāpiyasikā kiṃnidānā, kiṃsamudayā, kiṃjātikā, kiṃpabhavā, kiṃsambhārā, kiṃsamuṭṭhānā?
pli-tv-pvr11:40.6.eng: What is the source, the origin, the birth, the arising, the production, the origination of a further penalty?

pli-tv-pvr11:40.7.pli: Tiṇavatthārako kiṃnidāno, kiṃsamudayo, kiṃjātiko, kiṃpabhavo, kiṃsambhāro, kiṃsamuṭṭhāno?
pli-tv-pvr11:40.7.eng: What is the source, the origin, the birth, the arising, the production, the origination of covering over as if with grass?

pli-tv-pvr11:41.1.pli: Sammukhāvinayo nidānanidāno, nidānasamudayo, nidānajātiko, nidānapabhavo, nidānasambhāro, nidānasamuṭṭhāno.
pli-tv-pvr11:41.1.eng: Resolution face-to-face has sources as its source, its origin, its birth, its arising, its production, its origination.

pli-tv-pvr11:41.4.pli: paṭiññātakaraṇaṃ nidānanidānaṃ, nidānasamudayaṃ, nidānajātikaṃ, nidānapabhavaṃ, nidānasambhāraṃ, nidānasamuṭṭhānaṃ.
pli-tv-pvr11:41.4.eng: Acting according to what has been admitted …

pli-tv-pvr11:41.6.pli: tassapāpiyasikā nidānanidānā, nidānasamudayā, nidānajātikā, nidānapabhavā, nidānasambhārā, nidānasamuṭṭhānā.

pli-tv-pvr11:41.7.pli: Tiṇavatthārako nidānanidāno, nidānasamudayo, nidānajātiko, nidānapabhavo, nidānasambhāro, nidānasamuṭṭhāno.
pli-tv-pvr11:41.7.eng: Covering over as if with grass has sources as its source, its origin, its birth, its arising, its production, its origination.

pli-tv-pvr11:42.1.pli: Sammukhāvinayo kiṃnidāno, kiṃsamudayo, kiṃjātiko, kiṃpabhavo, kiṃsambhāro, kiṃsamuṭṭhāno?
pli-tv-pvr11:42.1.eng: What is the source, the origin, the birth, the arising, the production, the origination of resolution face-to-face?

pli-tv-pvr11:42.3.eng: … of resolution because of past insanity?

pli-tv-pvr11:42.4.eng: … of acting according to what has been admitted?

pli-tv-pvr11:42.7.pli: tiṇavatthārako kiṃnidāno, kiṃsamudayo, kiṃjātiko, kiṃpabhavo, kiṃsambhāro, kiṃsamuṭṭhāno?
pli-tv-pvr11:42.7.eng: What is the source, the origin, the birth, the arising, the production, the origination of covering over as if with grass?

pli-tv-pvr11:43.1.pli: Sammukhāvinayo hetunidāno, hetusamudayo, hetujātiko, hetupabhavo, hetusambhāro, hetusamuṭṭhāno.
pli-tv-pvr11:43.1.eng: Resolution face-to-face has causes as its source, its origin, its birth, its arising, its production, its origination.

pli-tv-pvr11:43.4.pli: paṭiññātakaraṇaṃ hetunidānaṃ, hetusamudayaṃ, hetujātikaṃ, hetupabhavaṃ, hetusambhāraṃ, hetusamuṭṭhānaṃ.
pli-tv-pvr11:43.4.eng: Acting according to what has been admitted …

pli-tv-pvr11:43.6.pli: tassapāpiyasikā hetunidānā, hetusamudayā, hetujātikā, hetupabhavā, hetusambhārā, hetusamuṭṭhānā.

pli-tv-pvr11:43.7.pli: Tiṇavatthārako hetunidāno, hetusamudayo, hetujātiko, hetupabhavo, hetusambhāro, hetusamuṭṭhāno.
pli-tv-pvr11:43.7.eng: Covering over as if with grass has causes as its source, its origin, its birth, its arising, its production, its origination.

pli-tv-pvr11:44.1.pli: Sammukhāvinayo kiṃnidāno, kiṃsamudayo, kiṃjātiko, kiṃpabhavo, kiṃsambhāro, kiṃsamuṭṭhāno?
pli-tv-pvr11:44.1.eng: What is the source, the origin, the birth, the arising, the production, the origination of resolution face-to-face?

pli-tv-pvr11:44.3.eng: … of resolution because of past insanity?

pli-tv-pvr11:44.4.eng: … of acting according to what has been admitted?

pli-tv-pvr11:44.7.pli: tiṇavatthārako kiṃnidāno, kiṃsamudayo, kiṃjātiko, kiṃpabhavo, kiṃsambhāro, kiṃsamuṭṭhāno?
pli-tv-pvr11:44.7.eng: What is the source, the origin, the birth, the arising, the production, the origination of covering over as if with grass?

pli-tv-pvr11:44.8.pli: Sammukhāvinayo paccayanidāno, paccayasamudayo, paccayajātiko, paccayapabhavo, paccayasambhāro, paccayasamuṭṭhāno.
pli-tv-pvr11:44.8.eng: Resolution face-to-face has conditions as its source, its origin, its birth, its arising, its production, its origination.

pli-tv-pvr11:44.11.pli: paṭiññātakaraṇaṃ paccayanidānaṃ, paccayasamudayaṃ, paccayajātikaṃ, paccayapabhavaṃ, paccayasambhāraṃ, paccayasamuṭṭhānaṃ.
pli-tv-pvr11:44.11.eng: Acting according to what has been admitted …

pli-tv-pvr11:44.13.pli: tassapāpiyasikā paccayanidānā, paccayasamudayā, paccayajātikā, paccayapabhavā, paccayasambhārā, paccayasamuṭṭhānā.

pli-tv-pvr11:44.14.pli: Tiṇavatthārako paccayanidāno, paccayasamudayo, paccayajātiko, paccayapabhavo, paccayasambhāro, paccayasamuṭṭhāno.
pli-tv-pvr11:44.14.eng: Covering over as if with grass has conditions as its source, its origin, its birth, its arising, its production, its origination.

pli-tv-pvr11:45.1.pli: Sattannaṃ samathānaṃ kati mūlāni, kati samuṭṭhānā?
pli-tv-pvr11:45.1.eng: How many roots do the seven principles for settling legal issues have, and how many originations?

pli-tv-pvr11:45.2.pli: Sattannaṃ samathānaṃ chabbīsa mūlāni, chattiṃsa samuṭṭhānā.
pli-tv-pvr11:45.2.eng: They have twenty-six roots and thirty-six originations.

pli-tv-pvr11:45.5.eng: face-to-face with the Sangha, face-to-face with the Teaching, face-to-face with the Monastic Law, face-to-face with the persons concerned.

pli-tv-pvr11:45.6.eng: Resolution through recollection has four roots.

pli-tv-pvr11:45.7.eng: Resolution because of past insanity has four roots.

pli-tv-pvr11:45.8.eng: Acting according to what has been admitted has two roots:

pli-tv-pvr11:45.9.pli: yo ca deseti yassa ca deseti;
pli-tv-pvr11:45.9.eng: The one who confesses and the one he confesses to.

pli-tv-pvr11:45.10.eng: A majority decision has four roots.

pli-tv-pvr11:45.11.eng: A further penalty has four roots.

pli-tv-pvr11:45.12.eng: Covering over as if with grass has four roots:

pli-tv-pvr11:45.13.eng: face-to-face with the Sangha, face-to-face with the Teaching, face-to-face with the Monastic Law, face-to-face with the persons concerned.

pli-tv-pvr11:46.2.pli: Sativinayassa kammassa kiriyā, karaṇaṃ, upagamanaṃ, ajjhupagamanaṃ, adhivāsanā, appaṭikkosanā.
pli-tv-pvr11:46.2.eng: The doing of, the performing of, the participation in, the consent to, the agreement to, the non-objection to a legal procedure of resolution through recollection.

pli-tv-pvr11:46.3.eng: … a legal procedure of resolution because of past insanity.

pli-tv-pvr11:46.4.eng: … a legal procedure of acting according to what has been admitted.

pli-tv-pvr11:46.5.eng: … a legal procedure of majority decision.

pli-tv-pvr11:46.6.eng: … a legal procedure of further penalty.

pli-tv-pvr11:46.7.pli: tiṇavatthārakassa kammassa kiriyā, karaṇaṃ, upagamanaṃ, ajjhupagamanaṃ, adhivāsanā, appaṭikkosanā—
pli-tv-pvr11:46.7.eng: The doing of, the performing of, the participation in, the consent to, the agreement to, the non-objection to a legal procedure of covering over as if with grass.

pli-tv-pvr11:47.0.eng: 10. The variety in meaning, etc., between the seven principles for settling legal issues

pli-tv-pvr11:47.1.pli: Sammukhāvinayoti vā sativinayoti vā—ime dhammā nānatthā nānābyañjanā, udāhu ekatthā byañjanameva nānaṃ?
pli-tv-pvr11:47.1.eng: “Are resolution face-to-face and resolution through recollection different in meaning and different in wording, or the same in meaning and just different in wording?
pli-tv-pvr11:47.1.comm: There is a ti at the end of the text, signifying the end of a quote, but it is not all clear where the quote is supposed to begin. It may well be that at some point the whole text was supposed to be quoted. Yet, the way the text is presented now, with interspersed headings, it is natural to start the quote only after the final heading, which is here. In other words, it does not make sense to include the headings within the quotes.

pli-tv-pvr11:47.2.eng: Are resolution face-to-face and resolution because of past insanity …

pli-tv-pvr11:47.3.eng: Are resolution face-to-face and acting according to what has been admitted …

pli-tv-pvr11:47.4.eng: Are resolution face-to-face and a majority decision …

pli-tv-pvr11:47.5.eng: Are resolution face-to-face and a further penalty …

pli-tv-pvr11:47.6.pli: sammukhāvinayoti vā tiṇavatthārakoti vā—ime dhammā nānatthā nānābyañjanā, udāhu ekatthā byañjanameva nānaṃ?
pli-tv-pvr11:47.6.eng: Are resolution face-to-face and covering over as if with grass different in meaning and different in wording, or the same in meaning and just different in wording?

pli-tv-pvr11:47.7.pli: Sammukhāvinayoti vā sativinayoti vā—ime dhammā nānatthā ceva nānābyañjanā ca.
pli-tv-pvr11:47.7.eng: Resolution face-to-face and resolution through recollection are different in meaning and different in wording.

pli-tv-pvr11:47.8.eng: Resolution face-to-face and resolution because of past insanity …

pli-tv-pvr11:47.9.eng: Resolution face-to-face and acting according to what has been admitted …

pli-tv-pvr11:47.10.eng: Resolution face-to-face and a majority decision …

pli-tv-pvr11:47.11.eng: Resolution face-to-face and a further penalty …

pli-tv-pvr11:47.12.pli: sammukhāvinayoti vā tiṇavatthārakoti vā—ime dhammā nānatthā ceva nānābyañjanā ca.
pli-tv-pvr11:47.12.eng: Resolution face-to-face and covering over as if with grass are different in meaning and different in wording.

pli-tv-pvr11:48.1.pli: Vivādo vivādādhikaraṇaṃ, vivādo no adhikaraṇaṃ, adhikaraṇaṃ no vivādo, adhikaraṇañceva vivādo ca?
pli-tv-pvr11:48.1.eng: Are there disputes that are also legal issues arising from a dispute? Are there disputes that are not legal issues? Are there legal issues that are not disputes? Are there legal issues that are also disputes?

pli-tv-pvr11:48.2.pli: Siyā vivādo vivādādhikaraṇaṃ, siyā vivādo no adhikaraṇaṃ, siyā adhikaraṇaṃ no vivādo, siyā adhikaraṇañceva vivādo ca.
pli-tv-pvr11:48.2.eng: There may be disputes that are also legal issues arising from a dispute. There may be disputes that are not legal issues. There may legal issues that are not disputes. There may be legal issues that are also disputes.

pli-tv-pvr11:49.1.eng: How is there a dispute that is also a legal issue arising from a dispute?

pli-tv-pvr11:49.2.pli: Idha bhikkhū vivadanti dhammoti vā adhammoti vā …pe…
pli-tv-pvr11:49.2.eng: It may be that the monks are disputing, saying, ‘This is the Teaching’, ‘This is contrary to the Teaching’ …

pli-tv-pvr11:49.3.pli: duṭṭhullā āpattīti vā aduṭṭhullā āpattīti vā.
pli-tv-pvr11:49.3.eng: ‘This is a grave offense’, or ‘This is a minor offense.’

pli-tv-pvr11:49.4.pli: Yaṃ tattha bhaṇḍanaṃ, kalaho, viggaho, vivādo, nānāvādo, aññathāvādo, vipaccatāya vohāro, medhakaṃ—
pli-tv-pvr11:49.4.eng: In regard to this, whatever there is of quarreling, arguing, conflict, disputing, variety in opinion, difference in opinion, heated speech, or strife—

pli-tv-pvr11:49.5.eng: this is a dispute that is also a legal issue arising from a dispute.

pli-tv-pvr11:50.1.eng: How is there a dispute that is not a legal issue?

pli-tv-pvr11:50.2.pli: Mātāpi puttena vivadati, puttopi mātarā vivadati, pitāpi puttena vivadati, puttopi pitarā vivadati, bhātāpi bhātarā vivadati, bhātāpi bhaginiyā vivadati, bhaginīpi bhātarā vivadati, sahāyopi sahāyena vivadati—
pli-tv-pvr11:50.2.eng: A mother disputes with her offspring; an offspring with their mother; a father with his offspring; an offspring with their father; a brother with his brother; a brother with his sister; a sister with her brother; a friend with their friend—

pli-tv-pvr11:50.3.eng: these are disputes that are not legal issues.

pli-tv-pvr11:51.1.eng: How is there a legal issue that is not a dispute?

pli-tv-pvr11:51.2.eng: A legal issue arising from an accusation, a legal issue arising from an offense, a legal issue arising from business—

pli-tv-pvr11:51.3.eng: these are legal issues that are not disputes.

pli-tv-pvr11:52.1.eng: How is there a legal issue that is also a dispute?

pli-tv-pvr11:52.2.eng: A legal issue arising from a dispute is a legal issue and also a dispute.

pli-tv-pvr11:53.1.pli: Anuvādo anuvādādhikaraṇaṃ, anuvādo no adhikaraṇaṃ, adhikaraṇaṃ no anuvādo, adhikaraṇañceva anuvādo ca?
pli-tv-pvr11:53.1.eng: Are there accusations that are also legal issues arising from accusations? Are there accusations that are not legal issues? Are there legal issues that are not accusations? Are there legal issues that are also accusations?

pli-tv-pvr11:53.2.pli: Siyā anuvādo anuvādādhikaraṇaṃ, siyā anuvādo no adhikaraṇaṃ, siyā adhikaraṇaṃ no anuvādo, siyā adhikaraṇañceva anuvādo ca.
pli-tv-pvr11:53.2.eng: There may be accusations that are also legal issues arising from accusations. There may be accusations that are not legal issues. There may be legal issues that are not accusations. There may legal issues that are also accusations.

pli-tv-pvr11:54.1.eng: How is there an accusation that is also a legal issue arising from an accusation?

pli-tv-pvr11:54.2.pli: Idha bhikkhū bhikkhuṃ anuvadanti sīlavipattiyā vā ācāravipattiyā vā diṭṭhivipattiyā vā ājīvavipattiyā vā.
pli-tv-pvr11:54.2.eng: It may be that the monks accuse a monk of failure in morality, failure in conduct, failure in view, or failure in livelihood.

pli-tv-pvr11:54.3.pli: Yo tattha anuvādo, anuvadanā anullapanā anubhaṇanā anusampavaṅkatā abbhussahanatā anubalappadānaṃ—
pli-tv-pvr11:54.3.eng: In regard to this, whatever there are of accusations, accusing, allegations, blame, taking sides because of friendship, taking part in the accusation, or supporting the accusation—

pli-tv-pvr11:54.4.eng: this is an accusation that is a legal issue arising from an accusation.

pli-tv-pvr11:55.1.eng: How is there an accusation that is not a legal issue?

pli-tv-pvr11:55.2.pli: Mātāpi puttaṃ anuvadati, puttopi mātaraṃ anuvadati, pitāpi puttaṃ anuvadati, puttopi pitaraṃ anuvadati, bhātāpi bhātaraṃ anuvadati, bhātāpi bhaginiṃ anuvadati, bhaginīpi bhātaraṃ anuvadati, sahāyopi sahāyaṃ anuvadati—
pli-tv-pvr11:55.2.eng: A mother accuses her offspring; an offspring their mother; a father his offspring; an offspring their father; a brother his brother; a brother his sister; a sister her brother; a friend their friend—

pli-tv-pvr11:55.3.eng: these are accusations that are not legal issues.

pli-tv-pvr11:56.1.eng: How is there a legal issue that is not an accusation?

pli-tv-pvr11:56.2.eng: A legal issue arising from an offense, a legal issue arising from business, a legal issue arising from a dispute—

pli-tv-pvr11:56.3.eng: these are legal issues that are not accusations.

pli-tv-pvr11:57.1.eng: How is there a legal issue that is also an accusation?

pli-tv-pvr11:57.2.eng: A legal issue arising from an accusation is a legal issue and also an accusation.

pli-tv-pvr11:58.1.pli: Āpatti āpattādhikaraṇaṃ, āpatti no adhikaraṇaṃ, adhikaraṇaṃ no āpatti, adhikaraṇañceva āpatti ca?
pli-tv-pvr11:58.1.eng: Are there offenses that are also legal issues arising from an offense? Are there offenses that are not legal issues? Are there legal issues that are not offenses? Are there legal issues that are also offenses?

pli-tv-pvr11:58.2.pli: Siyā āpatti āpattādhikaraṇaṃ, siyā āpatti no adhikaraṇaṃ, siyā adhikaraṇaṃ no āpatti, siyā adhikaraṇañceva āpatti ca.
pli-tv-pvr11:58.2.eng: There may be offenses that are also legal issues arising from an offense. There may be offenses that are not legal issues. There may be legal issues that are not offenses. There may be legal issues that are also offenses.

pli-tv-pvr11:59.1.eng: How is there an offense that is also a legal issue arising from an offense?

pli-tv-pvr11:59.2.eng: There are legal issues arising from offenses because of the five classes of offenses;

pli-tv-pvr11:59.3.eng: there are legal issues arising from offenses because of the seven classes of offenses—

pli-tv-pvr11:59.4.eng: these are offenses that are also legal issues arising from an offense.

pli-tv-pvr11:60.1.eng: How is there an offense that is not a legal issue?

pli-tv-pvr11:60.3.eng: this is an offense/attainment that is not a legal issue.
pli-tv-pvr11:60.3.comm: In the Pali, the word āpatti/samāpatti means both “attainment” and “offense”. The Pali is a play on words, which is impossible to replicate in English.

pli-tv-pvr11:61.1.eng: How is there a legal issue that is not an offense?

pli-tv-pvr11:61.2.eng: A legal issue arising from business, a legal issue arising from a dispute, a legal issue arising from an accusation—

pli-tv-pvr11:61.3.eng: these are legal issues that are not offenses.

pli-tv-pvr11:62.1.eng: How is there a legal issue that is also an offense?

pli-tv-pvr11:62.2.eng: A legal issue arising from an offense is a legal issue and also an offense.

pli-tv-pvr11:63.1.pli: Kiccaṃ kiccādhikaraṇaṃ, kiccaṃ no adhikaraṇaṃ, adhikaraṇaṃ no kiccaṃ, adhikaraṇañceva kiccañca?
pli-tv-pvr11:63.1.eng: Is there business that is also a legal issue arising from business? Is there business that is not a legal issue? Are there legal issues that are not business? Are there legal issues that are also business?

pli-tv-pvr11:63.2.pli: Siyā kiccaṃ kiccādhikaraṇaṃ, siyā kiccaṃ no adhikaraṇaṃ, siyā adhikaraṇaṃ no kiccaṃ, siyā adhikaraṇañceva kiccañca.
pli-tv-pvr11:63.2.eng: There may be business that is also a legal issue arising from business. There may be business that is not a legal issue. There may be legal issues that are not business. There may be legal issues that are also business.

pli-tv-pvr11:64.1.eng: How is there business that is also a legal issue arising from business?

pli-tv-pvr11:64.2.pli: Yā saṅghassa kiccayatā karaṇīyatā apalokanakammaṃ ñattikammaṃ ñattidutiyakammaṃ ñatticatutthakammaṃ—
pli-tv-pvr11:64.2.eng: Whatever is the duty or the business of the Sangha—a legal procedure consisting of getting permission, a legal procedure consisting of one motion, a legal procedure consisting of one motion and one announcement, a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements—

pli-tv-pvr11:64.3.eng: these are business that are also legal issues arising from business.

pli-tv-pvr11:65.1.eng: How is there business that is not a legal issue?

pli-tv-pvr11:65.2.eng: The duty to a teacher, the duty to a preceptor, the duty to a co-student, the duty to a co-pupil—

pli-tv-pvr11:65.3.eng: these are business that are not legal issues.

pli-tv-pvr11:66.1.eng: How is there a legal issue that is not business?

pli-tv-pvr11:66.2.eng: A legal issue arising from a dispute, a legal issue arising from an accusation, a legal issue arising from an offense—

pli-tv-pvr11:66.3.eng: these are legal issues that are not business.

pli-tv-pvr11:67.1.eng: How is there a legal issue that is also business?

pli-tv-pvr11:67.2.eng: A legal issue arising from business is a legal issue and also business.”

pli-tv-pvr11:68.1.eng: The four legal issues and their resolution are finished.

pli-tv-pvr11:71.6.eng: “This is in the subdivision on legal issues.”
